questions.title: 1. Are elections for the national legislature and head of government free?
questions.description: Consider whether elections are competitive in that electors are free to vote and are offered a range of choices.

options.full: Essentially unrestricted conditions for the presentation of candidates (for example, no bans on major parties).
options.medium: There are some restrictions on the electoral process.
options.short: A single-party system or major impediments exist (for example, bans on a major party or candidate).

questions.title: 2. Are elections for the national legislature and head of government fair?

options.full: No major irregularities in the voting process.
options.medium: Significant irregularities occur (intimidation, fraud), but do not significantly affect the overall outcome.
options.short: Major irregularities occur and affect the outcome.
